BusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: UNITED WAY OF JACKSON COUNTY INC

IRS990.MissionDesc: THE MISSION OF THE UNITED WAY OF JACKSON COUNTY, INC. IS MOBILIZING CARING TO AFFECT CHANGE.
IRS990.Desc: UNITED WAY CONDUCTS AN ANNUAL FUNDRAISING CAMPAIGN TO INVEST CRITICALLY NEEDED RESOURCES IN COMMUNITY IMPACT PROJECTS IN THE AREAS OF EDUCATION, INCOME, HEALTH AND TRANSPORTATION. THESE PROJECTS INCLUDE DAY OF CARING, HOPE CHEST, WILL, AND 24 OTHER IMPACT PROJECTS. OUR COMMUNITY IMPACT PROJECTS INCLUDE BIG IDEA NEXT, A PROGRAM FOCUSED ON INCREASING GRADUATION FOR STUDENTS IN ALTERNATIVE PROGRAMS; IN THIS TOGETHER, OUR MENTAL WELLNESS AND SUICIDE PREVENTION PROGRAMS; VITA/FSA, OUR FREE INCOME TAX PREPARATION; AND MOBILITY MANAGEMENT TO REDUCE BARRIERS FOR PEOPLE TO GET WHERE THEY WANT AND NEED TO GO.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: UNITED WAY COLLECTS DONOR DOLLARS TO INVEST FOR IMPACT IN PROGRAMS PROVIDING EDUCATION, INCOME, HEALTH AND TRANSPORTATION PROGRAMS SERVING TWO OUT OF THREE PEOPLE IN JACKSON COUNTY. THIS FISCAL YEAR, UNITED WAY FUNDED 25 PROGRAMS, INCLUDING EVERYTHING FROM EARLY CHILDHOOD PROGRAMS TO SENIOR MEALS AND MUCH OF LIFE THAT FALLS IN BETWEEN. DONOR DOLLARS CAN BE DESIGNATED TO A SPECIFIC 501(C)(3) AND UNITED WAY HONORS DONOR CHOICE. FEES ARE WITHHELD FOR FUNDRAISING, ADMINISTRATION AND PLEDGE LOSS. THE ALLOCATIONS PROCESS IS MANAGED BY VOLUNTEERS WHO RECEIVE TRAINING, REVIEW APPLICATIONS, CONDUCT SITE VISITS AND SCORE/EVALUATION EACH APPLICATION AND VISIT. VOLUNTEERS MAKE RECOMMENDATIONS TO THE UNITED WAY BOARD OF DIRECTORS WHO HAVE FINAL APPROVAL OF ALL ALLOCATIONS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: IN GENERAL, THE UNITED WAY OF JACKSON COUNTY USES EARNINGS ON ENDOWMENT FUNDS ANNUALLY TO SUPPORT PROGRAM SERVICE ACCOMPLISHMENTS, KEEPING THE ENDOWMENT FUNDS PRINCIPAL INTACT IN PERPETUITY.

RecipientTable.PurposeOfGrantTxt: SEXUAL ASSAULT SERVICES AND DUNN HOUSE SHELTER

RecipientBusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: CONSUMER CREDIT COUNSELING SERVICE OF SO

RecipientTable.PurposeOfGrantTxt: RESTORATIVE JUSTICE IN SOUTHERN OREGON SCHOOLS

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE UNITED WAY CONDUCTS BI-ANNUAL SITE VISITS WITH VOLUNTEER REVIEWERS, MID-CYCLE (ANNUAL REPORTING) EVALUATIONS ON OUTCOME TARGETS AND ACHIEVEMENTS, SUCCESS STORY AND DEMOGRAPHIC REPORTING. FINANCIAL REPORTING IS REQUIRED BASED ON THE FUNDING LEVEL AND BUDGET OF THE GRANTEE ORGANIZATION. THE LOWEST LEVEL OF REPORTING IS FOR ORGANIZATIONS WITH LESS THAN $500,000 BUDGETS WHO RECEIVE LESS THAN $10,000 ANNUALLY. THESE ORGANIZATIONS ARE REQUIRED TO SUBMIT TO THE UNITED WAY A COPY OF THEIR IRS FORM 990. ORGANIZATIONS WHO RECEIVE MORE THAN $10,000 ANNUALLY ARE ALSO REQUIRED TO SUBMIT TO THE UNITED WAY A COPY OF THEIR ANNUAL INDEPENDENTLY AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FINANCE COMMITTEE OF THE ORGANIZATION REVIEWS THE FORM 990 BEFORE IT IS FILED AND THE BOARD IS OFFERED REVIEW OPPORTUNITIES. A COPY OF THE FORM 990 IS GIVEN TO THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: VOLUNTEERS AND STAFF OF THE ORGANIZATION ARE REQUIRED TO ANNUALLY COMPLETE THE CODE OF ETHICS FORM, WHICH INCLUDES DISCLOSING POTENTIAL CONFLICTS OF INTEREST. IN ADDITION, THE BOARD ASKS FOR DISCLOSURE OF POTENTIAL CONFLICTS BEFORE VOTING ON ALLOCATION OF FUNDS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE PERSONNEL COMMITTEE OF THE ORGANIZATION IS RESPONSIBLE FOR THE ANNUAL EVALUATION OF THE CEO/EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR. THE EVALUATION IS 360 DEGREES WITH INPUT FROM BOARD MEMBERS, PERSONNEL COMMITTEE MEMBERS, STAFF, AGENCY DIRECTORS, AND SELECTED COMMUNITY PARTNERS. THE UNITED WAY SUBSCRIBES AND PARTICIPATES IN A STATEWIDE NONPROFIT SALARY SURVEY PRODUCED BY MBL GROUP. THIS IS USED FOR COMPARABLE SALARY INFORMATION. THERE ARE NO OTHER OFFICERS OR KEY EMPLOYEES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION POSTS ITS IRS FORM 990 ON ITS WEBSITE. OTHER GOVERNING DOCUMENTS AND POLICIES ARE AVAILABLE TO ANY INTERESTED PARTY UPON REQUEST. THE ORGANIZATION POSTS ITS AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ON ITS WEBSITE.
